ai/overview.title: AI Agent Overview
ai/overview.description: Zeckna’s AI layer converts natural language intents into wallet operations. It balances local inference for lightweight commands with cloud providers for heavy planning tasks.

ai/privacy-advisor.title: Privacy Advisor
ai/privacy-advisor.description: The Privacy Advisor scores planned actions and recommends mitigations when they violate user-defined policies.

ai/transaction-pipelines.title: Transaction Pipelines
ai/transaction-pipelines.description: Pipelines coordinate parsing, policy checks, and transaction building with explicit checkpoints. They help you mix automated steps with human approvals.

changelog.title: Changelog
changelog.description: Track notable updates across the Zeckna stack.

getting-started/configuration.title: Configuration & Environment
getting-started/configuration.description: Secure configuration keeps shielded keys private while enabling AI services to reason over wallet data.

getting-started/install.title: Install the Toolchain
getting-started/install.description: Zeckna uses pnpm workspaces to manage Rust, TypeScript, and React Native projects. Install the prerequisites before cloning the repository.

getting-started/workspaces.title: Workspace Layout
getting-started/workspaces.description: Zeckna lives in a pnpm monorepo under packages/. Each package targets a distinct layer of the stack.

intro.title: Welcome to Zeckna
intro.description: Zeckna is a privacy-first wallet, SDK, and AI automation layer that blends Zcash shielded transactions with Solana-grade performance. The project ships as a pnpm monorepo with Rust, TypeScript, React Native, and AI services working together.

reference/ai.title: AI Reference
reference/ai.description: The @zeckna/ai package exports modular functions for natural language processing, privacy scoring, and scheduling.

reference/core.title: Core (Rust) Reference
reference/core.description: The @zeckna/core package wraps the Rust library compiled via wasm-pack. Key modules:

reference/sdk.title: SDK Reference
reference/sdk.description: @zeckna/sdk is a TypeScript package that re-exports high-level functions from the WASM core.

sdk/keys.title: Key Management
sdk/keys.description: Zeckna wraps the Rust core’s key derivation helpers to produce seed phrases, spending keys, and viewing keys.

sdk/quickstart.title: SDK Quickstart
sdk/quickstart.description: The TypeScript SDK provides async wrappers around the Rust core’s WebAssembly bindings.

sdk/transactions.title: Transaction APIs
sdk/transactions.description: The SDK exposes helpers to craft shielded or transparent Zcash transactions. Shielded flows rely on the Rust core’s circuit integrations and return serialized transactions ready for broadcasting.

sdk/view-keys.title: Viewing Keys
sdk/view-keys.description: Viewing keys allow third parties to monitor incoming and outgoing shielded transactions without enabling spends.

vision.title: Vision & Principles
vision.description: Zeckna aims to make private finance programmable. The roadmap is guided by three principles:

wallet/architecture.title: Wallet Architecture
wallet/architecture.description: The React Native wallet orchestrates UI flows on top of the SDK and AI services. Key layers:

wallet/mobile.title: Mobile Build Targets
wallet/mobile.description: The React Native application is configured for both iOS and Android using Expo-less bare workflows.

wallet/storage.title: Secure Storage
wallet/storage.description: Seed phrases and spending keys must stay encrypted. The mobile storage service provides a unified interface.
